The beautiful bedding has landed an impressive 4.6 out of five-star rating, serving up coastal vibes by the bucket load Laura Mckenna Audience Writer This article contains affiliate links, we will receive a commission on any sales we generate from it. Learn more The Hebden Bedding set also comes in other colours(Image: Dunelm) Dunelm shoppers can't stop raving about a "soft and silky" bedding set that "looks much more expensive than it is." The Linen Yard Hebden Reversible 100% Cotton Duvet Cover & Pillowcase Set features a fashionable striped design, with discounts available on selected colours. Usually costing between £24 and £50, the double size is now £34, the king size is now £40 and the largest super king has been reduced to £44 in black, green, red, blush, grey, beige and sage colourways. According to Dunelm, the duvet cover features "a reversible subtle melange striped print for a textured appearance." The bedding set includes standard pillowcases and is made from 100% cotton with a 144 thread count. The button closure allows for straightforward removal of the duvet, and the set is machine washable. Incorporating whites, navy blues and soft neutrals, the Hebden duvet set pairs well with the light, airy feel of flinging the windows wide open. If this striped bedding isn't quite right, Next is bringing ocean vibes into the bedroom with the Blue Tufted Puffin Cotton Duvet Cover and Pillowcase Set. Starting from £40 for the single size, the bedding set is made from pure cotton with embroidered and tufting detail and an all-over puffin print. At Argos, shoppers can pick up the Habitat Cotton Oxford Edge Stripe Cream Bedding Set, with a subtle stripe and neutral hue. At £20 for the single size, buyers have called it "a gorgeous bedding set" that "looks fab and fresh on the bed." Save on The Linen Yard Hebden Bedding From £24 Product Description Dunelm has dropped the price of the striped duvet cover set Buyers with a bigger budget could also consider the Remy 200 Thread Count Stripe Duvet Cover & Pillowcase Set from Dusk. Currently on promotion, the hotel-style bedding starts from £45 and has been described as being "fresh and light." Buyers who have already snapped up The Linen Yard Hebden Reversible Cotton Duvet Set have given it an impressive 4.6 out of five-star rating. One buyer said "This bedding set is gorgeous, lovely cotton, washes really well and so comfortable to sleep in. The pillowcases are Oxfords with a really deep envelope so stay on the pillows well. The set is reversible and just so stylish." A second shopper added: "Beautiful and practical cotton bedding. It washes, line-dries quickly and irons like a dream. Oh, I nearly forgot, it looks amazing in our bedroom!" The striped set is "beautiful and practical cotton bedding." (Image: Dunelm) Another buyer was impressed with the quality, saying: "Lovely duvet cover, nice quality, soft cotton. Looks like it should be more expensive than it is." A fourth added: "This bedding is so soft and luxurious. I'm very happy with it, colour is lovely." Not everyone was quite so taken with the bedding set. One disappointed shopper only gave it a two-star review that said: "Rather disappointing - it feels 'old' from being brand new - like it had been in someone's airing cupboard for many years. Another five-star review added: "The quality is amazing, straight out of the packing the butter soft cotton is a pleasure to touch. NEED TO KNOW George and Amal Clooney stepped out for another red carpet date night, this time in London The couple attended The King's Trust and TKMaxx & Homesense Awards on June 26 The Clooneys met with King Charles at Buckingham Palace the day prior George and Amal Clooney's date night streak continues! The actor, 64, and the human rights activist lawyer, 47, attended The King's Trust and TKMaxx & Homesense Awards in London, on Thursday, June 26. For the occasion, the Wolfs actor kept his look classic and wore a navy blue suit with matching slacks. The star completed the outfit with a white button down shirt — worn with a few buttons undone for a casual vibe — black dress shoes and black aviator sunglasses. The star's hair was also back to its signature silver fox gray, which returned following the completion of his run on Broadway for Good Night, and Good Luck. Nicky J Sims/Getty George Clooney (left) and Amal Clooney attend The King's Trust and TKMaxx & Homesense Awards 2025 at The Royal Festival Hall on June 26, 2025 in London, England. Amal wore a simple dress for her and George's date night — the activist attended the event in a bright white column gown with an oversized metal piece that formed a halter top around her neck. The dress also featured a thigh-high slit on each side of the dress to allow ease of movement. George Clooney (left) and Amal Clooney attend The King's Trust and TKMaxx & Homesense Awards 2025 at The Royal Festival Hall on June 26, 2025 in London, England Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. The couple's last public outing took place on Wednesday, also in London, where the pair attended the reception for the winners of the 2025 King's Trust Awards at Buckingham Palace, where they met King Charles. For the evening, the couple coordinated in black and gray, with George wearing a gray suit with a black button down shirt and Amal wearing a black satin off the shoulder column gown. Stefan Rousseau/PA Images via Getty King Charles III speaks with (left to right) Charlotte Tilbury, George and Amal Clooney and Alice, during a reception for the winners of the King's Trust Awards 2025 at Buckingham Palace, London on June 25, 2025. Prior to their London outings, George and Amal attended the 2025 Tony Awards on June 8 and channeled old Hollywood glamour for the event. The actor, who was nominated for best actor in a play for Good Night, and Good Luck, wore a black tuxedo with a matching black bowtie. Amal embraced another fitted silhouette, but wore an off the shoulder gown covered in pearls. Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Amal Clooney and George Clooney attend The 78th Annual Tony Awards at Radio City Music Hall on June 08, 2025 in New York City. On the red carpet, George discussed removing his dark hair color after Good Night, and Good Luck closed on Broadway. The PEOPLE App is now available in the Apple App Store! Download it now for the most binge-worthy celeb content, exclusive video clips, astrology updates and more! “Oh man, my wife [Amal] was the happiest person when I came home after the play today and I'd cut all the hair off,” he told Entertainment Weekly and PEOPLE on the Tonys red carpet. “Because, you know, I looked like a drug dealer with that bad black dye job.” Prior to getting rid of the black dye, George called the color “funny” during his June 2 appearance on Late Night with Seth Meyers. The ER actor added that Amal would "be glad when it's gone,” because the color made him look “like [I'm] going through some horrible midlife crisis. I'm 64 — midlife is a little stretch."

Your wish is my command — I give you a makeup artist-approved moisturizer, an eight-second hair treatment, and an exfoliating mitt to get rid of dead skin. 1. Terez & Honor eyelash serum to help grow those lashes to new heights! Just apply this along the lash line every night to help give you the natural falsies look. Plus, this works on your eyebrows as well! No lash serum will work overnight, but with consistent use, you'll be able to see longer and fuller looking lashes! Promising review: "I've always been skeptical of lash serums like this, but the reviews were great, so I decided to try it. After using for a few weeks, I noticed that my eyelashes had grown to the point that they touched my eyebrows! I honestly didn't think this was going to work, but was pleasantly surprised when it did. It works great to grow out your eyebrows as well!" —Erin Get it from Amazon for $22.49. 2. L'Oréal Paris Elvive 8 Second Wonder Water for those of you who don't have the time *or* the money to be sitting in a salon chair all day but still want some luscious-looking locks. Leave this lamellar water treatment in for 8 seconds, yes... 8 seconds only, and rinse out for silkier, shinier, healthier-looking hair. Promising review: "I don't usually do reviews on products, but for this one I absolutely have to. I have 3c type hair and struggle with a lot a breakage, unmanageability, and moisture. When my mom mentioned this product to me, I didn't take her seriously because of the simple fact that we have two completely different hair textures. I never would have thought this brand would work on my hair ... I have never in my 22 years felt my hair like this. I feel like I have a completely different head of hair. This product is so amazing and I will FOREVER be using this product in my hair regimen." —Theressa Hailey Get it from Amazon for $10.97. 3. An Anua pore-clearing cleansing oil that'll visibly remove any makeup, sunscreen, or excess sebum from your long day. This K-beauty product (formulated with soothing heartleaf extract) is perfect for anyone looking to double cleanse, and it'll glide on your face so smoothly. Promising review: "My skin is *super* sensitive, but as I've aged (44 years), I feel like my pores have become more visible. I hadn't used an oil cleanser before and wasn't 100% sure how it should all work. The Anua oil cleanser works how we all once hoped Biore pore strips would work back in the day but without any pain or irritation. My skin is combination skin, so I have to be really careful about not drying out the dry spots (and getting eczema) and not over-hydrating the oily spots (and getting a breakout). I rub the oil on my face as the first part of my cleansing routine; I massage it in for ~60 seconds and then put a small amount of water on my fingers and begin rubbing that on my face. The water starts the emulsification process and helps to clean out everything the oil has bonded to/mixed with. Then, I just rinse it clean and use a gentle cleanser afterward. I haven't had any irritation, redness, or fallout from adding this product to my skincare routine. I love it. I am almost through my first bottle and if I go a few days without using the cleanser, my pores become more visible/dirty again. I will definitely keep purchasing the Anua oil cleanser." —Tassa Get it from Amazon for $17.69. 4. A waterproof eyeliner stamp if you know all too well the struggle of making the left eyeliner match the right eyeliner only to find that you went overboard and turned yourself into a raccoon. Thanks to this, all you need to do is stamp the wing on the outer corner of your eye and flip it over to the fine tip to finish off the job! Promising review: "This eyeliner is worth the buy, do it now!!! It is very easy to apply and once it is on, it stays in place unless you wipe it off. I love, love, love this eyeliner. —Catrinna F. The Flick Stick comes from New Zealand-based brand and small biz Lovoir Beauty. Get it from Amazon for $14.98 (available in three sizes and a combo pack). 5. A cruelty-free extreme hold eyebrow gel, a nonsticky formula that's literally called "The Brow Glue" — and for good reason because it holds for up to 16 hours!...

The global Makeup Market is rapidly transforming, not just in terms of products but in how consumers interact with them. Augmented reality (AR) and virtual try-on technologies are revolutionizing the way shoppers discover, test, and purchase makeup. These innovations have become key differentiators for beauty brands, creating immersive, personalized, and convenient experiences that bridge the gap between physical and digital retail. As consumer behavior shifts toward e-commerce and contactless engagement, AR-powered tools are reshaping the beauty retail landscape—offering users the ability to try on lipstick, foundation, eyeliner, and more with just a smartphone camera or webcam. What was once a novelty is now a necessity for forward-thinking makeup brands and retailers. A New Era of Virtual Beauty The beauty industry thrives on visual impact, and AR has proven to be a perfect fit. With virtual try-on (VTO) solutions, consumers can see how a makeup product looks on their face in real-time, without ever opening a tube or swatching a palette. This technology uses facial mapping and machine learning algorithms to detect skin tone, facial features, and lighting conditions, delivering a surprisingly realistic application. These tools are especially helpful when shopping online, where the lack of physical interaction traditionally hindered cosmetic purchases. Now, consumers can experiment with dozens of shades and styles, try different combinations, and make confident decisions—all from their smartphones. According to a recent study by Perfect Corp, a leading AR beauty tech company, brands that integrated VTO technology saw a 200% increase in conversion rates and a 30% decrease in product return rates. Clearly, this innovation is not just about novelty—it's driving measurable results. E-Commerce Integration and Consumer Empowerment As e-commerce continues to grow, AR and VTO tools are becoming essential components of online beauty retail. Major platforms like Sephora, Ulta, Amazon, and Nykaa have embraced AR solutions, integrating them into product pages to enhance user experience. Consumers can now try on multiple products in one session, compare shades, and receive personalized recommendations based on their preferences and skin tone. This interactivity empowers consumers, especially younger, tech-savvy shoppers who expect engaging, personalized shopping experiences. It also fosters inclusivity by allowing users of all skin tones, face shapes, and ages to visualize products tailored to their unique features—addressing a long-standing issue in the beauty industry. Additionally, AR tools eliminate the hygiene concerns of traditional in-store testers, a concern that has grown since the COVID-19 pandemic. With safety and convenience top of mind, virtual try-ons provide a seamless and sanitary alternative that enhances brand trust and consumer satisfaction. The Role of AI and Personalization Augmented reality in the makeup market is increasingly being paired with artificial intelligence (AI) to offer hyper-personalized beauty experiences. AI analyzes user data—such as facial structure, skin tone, and past preferences—to generate curated product suggestions and customized beauty routines. For instance, AI-powered tools can recommend the ideal foundation shade, suggest complementary lip colors, or create full makeup looks based on current trends. Some platforms even allow users to upload photos for detailed skin analysis, identifying concerns like redness, pigmentation, or dryness, and pairing them with suitable products. This level of personalization not only enhances the shopping experience but also strengthens brand loyalty. Consumers are more likely to return to a platform or brand that understands their needs and delivers relevant solutions. Bridging Online and Offline: The Omnichannel Advantage AR isn't limited to online channels. Forward-thinking retailers are bringing the same technology into physical stores to enhance the in-person shopping experience. Interactive mirrors, smart kiosks, and AR-enabled screens allow customers to try on products without touching them—adding a futuristic, fun, and contactless dimension to brick-and-mortar retail. For example, L'Oréal's ModiFace platform has been deployed both online and in stores, allowing users to virtually apply lipstick, blush, and eyeshadow with a high degree of accuracy. Charlotte Tilbury and MAC Cosmetics have also implemented smart mirrors in flagship locations to attract foot traffic and increase engagement. This omnichannel approach ensures consistency across all touchpoints, offering customers a seamless transition from digital exploration to physical purchase—or vice versa. Boosting Engagement on Social Media Social media platforms are also integrating AR technology, giving brands new ways to engage audiences. Instagram and Snapchat filters allow users to try on makeup in-app and share their looks with followers, driving organic reach and user-generated content. TikTok, already a beauty trend hub, is testing AR features that enable branded try-on experiences within videos. Such integrations blur the lines between entertainment and shopping, turning product discovery into a viral, shareable activity. Influencers and content creators can demonstrate virtual try-ons in real-time, expanding reach and building credibility through interactive storytelling. Challenges and Future Potential While AR and VTO tools are revolutionizing the makeup market, challenges remain. Ensuring color accuracy across different devices and lighting conditions is still a technical hurdle. Additionally, some users express concerns about data privacy and facial recognition technologies, urging brands to implement strong ethical practices. However, the future of AR in beauty is promising. Advancements in 3D rendering, real-time facial tracking, and haptic feedback could eventually lead to even more immersive experiences. Brands may soon offer fully virtual makeup tutorials, avatar-based consultations, and live AR beauty shows. Conclusion As the makeup market evolves, augmented reality and virtual try-on tools are becoming essential to meet the expectations of modern consumers....

We held two workshops in the month of May highlighting our State AG and Privacy practice groups. In Chicago, our AG group hosted Navigating Consumer Protection in a Shifting Political Landscape, bringing together... EVENT RECAP We held two workshops in the month of May highlighting our State AG and Privacy practice groups. In Chicago, our AG group hosted Navigating Consumer Protection in a Shifting Political Landscape, bringing together legal professionals, state regulators, and thought leaders to discuss consumer protection enforcement, regulatory trends, and the evolving challenges facing businesses. In NYC, our Privacy group hosted the Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB) workshop focused on Health Insights & Beyond, discussing the current legal and regulatory landscape, and related opportunities and challenges for adtech privacy and health-related advertising. Special guests included industry experts, adtech vendors, and regulators from neighboring states. Thank you to all that attended. If you are interested in receiving more information about events at Kelley Drye, please contact Business Development and Marketing Manager, Ann Koepke. UPCOMING EVENTS Navigating the Maze of Influencer Marketing Webinar: Wednesday June 4, 2025 | 1:00 pm – 1:30 pm The FTC's requirements for influencer campaigns have gotten more complicated, and they aren't always intuitive. Unfortunately, many companies aren't complying with the new requirements, leaving them open to challenges. Although enforcement from the FTC has decreased, enforcement from other sources has increased. Join Kelley Drye Partner Gonzalo Mon as he covers what you need to know in just 30 minutes. Gonzalo will address topics including: Influencer disclosures Gifting campaigns Recent NAD cases and class actions Tips for managing influencer programs If you are interested in attending this webinar, please contact Ann Koepke. IN THE NEWS AND LATEST UPDATES Get these and other stories in real time when you subscribe to the Ad Law Access blog here or visit the Advertising and Privacy Law Resource Center here....

The formula is said to be light and breathable but also provides coverage wherever needed, perfect for covering blemishes. Designed to use as a last step of skincare, the moisturiser is available in 16 shades catering to pink, neutral, yellow, red and golden undertones. Shoppers have been heaping praise on the product, with one 85-year-old saying it made her realise: "I do not need a heavy foundation." The non-comedogenic formula includes Sodium Hyaluronate, a great humectant that is smaller in size than hyaluronic acid, which helps restore suppleness and improve the appearance of dry skin. It also protects skin's moisture barrier from water loss. Recently, Amazon's aggressive pricing had been called out as the primary factor impacting SEPHORA's online growth ambitions in the US. I delved deeper and data shows a more nuanced story. Turns out, Pricing is not Sephora's main struggle ! Some key highlights on the data - The share of beauty and personal care sales taking place online in the US, increased from 35% in 2023 to 39% in 2024. - Amazon's share in beauty and personal care e-commerce increased to 47% from 44% during this period. - Sephora, the second-largest online retailer for beauty and personal care in the US, experienced a slight market share dip from 10% in 2023 to 9% in 2024 despite growing value sales. - Color Cosmetics and Skin care collectively form nearly 70% of Sephora's online sales in the US, both categories experienced a decline in online sales. - Most top-performing brands in colour cosmetics, including Charlotte Tilbury, Rare Beauty, and Sephora, had higher average prices at Amazon compared to Sephora in 2024. Despite lower prices, these brands experienced sales declines on Sephora. - Charlotte Tilbury, continues to decline across both retailers. - In skin care, most brands posted growth on Amazon in 2024 despite higher average prices. While Laneíge, Sol de Janereiro, Claudalie and Tower 28 saw lower prices on Amazon, these brands performed well across both retailers, with higher share of sales made via Sephora online. ➖ Source: Euromonitor International Read on to know what really should matter more for Sephora and its peer retailers in today's e-commerce landscape : http://bit.ly/3TNr8U7 #brandstrategy #ecommerce #sephora #amazon Fortune #digital #beauty Huda Beauty Rare Beauty NARS Cosmetics TATCHA  Charlotte Tilbury Beauty

Beauty fans wanting to stock up on premium anti-ageing products for less can snap up a Rodial skincare set on LookFantastic. TheRodial Dragon's Blood Little Luxuries Kit offers a four-step routine for firmer and brighter skin - and it's currently on 48% off. Reduced from £106 to £55 and featuring the skincare's iconic Dragon's Blood range, the Little Luxuries Kit is designed to hydrate, plump and soothe, for a dewy complexion. Shoppers can get a full-size 100ml Dragon's Blood Cleansing Water, and deluxe sizes of the Sculpting Gel, Eye Gel and Velvet Cream. For those who are not familiar with the active ingredient, Dragon's Blood is a tree sap that contains blood-like pigments and is collected from Dragon trees found on the coast of Yemen. It has anti-inflammatory properties, helping with hydration, calming irritation, and potentially reducing breakouts. Among the set, shoppers will find the Dragon's Blood Sculpting Gel, which costs £95 for a full size, it's a firming serum blended with actives including Collageneer and Volufiline to improve the elasticity and firmness in the complexion, leaving it more toned and plumped. Scoring a 4.8 star based on 158 reviews, shoppers said it boosted skin hydration and skin elasticity. One shared: "My skin is at its best it has been since menopause wrecked it." "Being 50+ I needed all the help I could regarding plumpness for my face," a second chimed in. "I have tried many high end products and can honestly say that this is the first one I truly thought I can see and feel a big difference." Some people found the Sculpting Gel performing average with no visible difference after using it, but one said it made her skin look "10 years younger". Other than Rodial, their sister brand Nip+Fab also offer a Dragon's Blood Fix Plumping Serum at a more affordable price and it's now reduced to £14.39 on Amazon. Shoppers can also visit Debenhams for the skinChemists Youth Series Sensitive Serum Dragon's Blood 5% 30ml x 2 Duo Pack, which has been marked down with 52% and dropped to £21.90. The lightweight, fast-absorbing formula hydrates the skin for a radiant glow, making it ideal for both day and night use. An absolutely genius device called a "Supoon" — this perfectly sized spoon not only helps you scrape every last bit of food from the container (think: peanut butter, yogurt, cream cheese, etc.) but also has a unique design that keeps it away from the countertop when you set it down! This is about to prevent SO many "babe, stop leaving your peanut butter spoon on the counter" arguments. Natalie Brown / BuzzFeed "When I impulse-bought this mini spatula (called a "supoon") at the grocery store a few years ago, I knew it was good, but not THIS good. See that little dip in the neck? That means you can set it down on the counter and whatever's on it won't end up touching said counter. Here's a few of the many things I use this dishwasher-safe beauty for — and yep, it makes it into basically every dishwasher load, I use it THAT frequently. - Scraping every last bit of sauce, curry, salad dressing, or soup out of takeout or leftover containers, like in the picture above. This happens several times a week. I want every bit of all that flavor!! - Measuring out a few teaspoons of water when re-steaming takeout rice in the microwave. - Scraping out yogurt, hummus, salsa, hot sauce, peanut butter, expensive Bonne Maman jams, etc., etc., when I'm down to the last little bit of each. (It's too big for most beauty products, but that's fine.) - Mixing together a quick stir-fry sauce in a measuring cup, then scraping that sauce out of the cup into the pan, all with a single utensil. - Scrambling together a mixture of eggs and whatever else I want in a bowl and scraping all of that into a pan. - Scooping pancake batter my MIL sent over into a pan to make my 9-month-old fresh pancakes, including scraping the last bits out to get as much pancake as possible. Like, I know I functioned in the kitchen before I had this, but this saves me so much time scraping over and over with a spoon. And that price! A no-brainer. " — Natalie Brown Get it from Amazon for $6.99 , and find more sizes and colors on the Dreamfarm Amazon Store Page . 2. Miss Mouth's Messy Eater Stain Treater Spray , which is so effective that you'll remain suspiciously calm the next time your tot's chocolate milk makes its way from their sippy cup to the couch cushion. Or when your glass of merlot faces a similar fate. Just spray, blot, rinse, and pour another. Heather Braga/BuzzFeed " My 1-year-old is a big ice pop fan, so I've got a long life ahead of me to be filled with stain removal. In the above photo I held her while she sucked down a red ice pop on a 90 degree day. Naturally, it dripped all over my white tank top (note to self: stop wearing white around these kids). I was actually kind of excited because it meant I got to put my newly purchased bottle of Miss Mouth's Messy Eater Stain Treater Spray to the test! I followed the directions on the bottle that said to dampen the stained area, spray it with the stain remover, then pop it into the washing machine as usual. What do ya know — it really worked! Completely cleared away all the red stains! Not sure what witchcraft has been used to make this product, but I'm here for it." — Heather Braga Promising review: "My 1-year-old has taco meat stains ALL over the sleeves of his shirt. The stains were 2–3 days old, too. I sprayed the shirt, let it sit for about 15 minutes, and then washed the shirt with regular laundry soap. Almost every bit of the stains came out. Definitely buying bulk in this product!" — Sloan Avery Get it from Amazon for $7.97 (available in three sizes and multipacks). 3. A Ninja Swirl machine that makes soft serve ice cream at the touch of a button, which is truly the future Spy Kids promised us. You can also use it to whip up frozen yogurt, frozen custard, sorbet, milkshakes, and scooped ice cream. Heather Braga / BuzzFeed "I have this machine and can assure you it is actually worth every penny. IDK about you, but where I live in New York, it's gotten VERY expensive to go out for ice cream (or buy it to bring home). Now that I have a family of four, it just makes more sense to find a way to make our favorite flavors at home. Setting the Ninja Swirl up was very simple; the "hardest" part is just remembering to freeze the "base" of your ice creams ahead of time so they're ready to be "spun" when you want to eat them. I've seen all over TikTok how people 'meal prep' their ice creams for the week and just pop 'em in the freezer (incredible). Anyways, the soft serve feature is incredible!...

SPR_COMBO[de]*Anzeige/ Werbung Ein tolles Produkttest von influenster und der Marke charlottetilbury Ich durfte den neuen #Unreal #Blush von. Charlotte Tilbury in der Farbe Sherry Glow testen – und ich muss sagen: Ich bin wirklich positiv überrascht! Zuerst das Packaging – typisch Charlotte Tilbury: luxuriös, hochwertig und einfach ein Hingucker auf jedem Schminktisch. Der Blush selbst ist ein flüssiges Gel-Cream-Produkt, das sich super einfach mit den Fingern oder einem Pinsel auftragen lässt. Die Textur ist leicht und verschmilzt fast schon mit der Haut – kein Absetzen, kein Fleckigwerden. Die Farbe "Sherry Glow" ist ein wunderschöner, warm-rosiger Ton mit einem ganz feinen Glow. Kein grober Glitzer, sondern eher ein natürlich strahlender Schimmer, der dem Gesicht sofort Frische verleiht. Ich finde, der Ton passt besonders gut zu mittleren bis leicht gebräunten Hauttönen – er zaubert diese “frisch-von-der-Sonne-geküsst”-Ausstrahlung. Mein Fazit: Ein tolles Produkt für alle, die den “dewy”, frischen Look lieben! Wer auf natürliche Ausstrahlung steht und Lust auf einen unkomplizierten Sommer-Blush hat, wird mit "Sherry Glow" richtig glücklich. Für mich ein echtes Highlight in meiner Sommer-Make-up-Routine obwohl ich eher immer noch zum Puder tendiere. 9 von 10 ⭐ #complimentary #charlottetilbury #unrealblush #influenster #produkttester #testen #blush #rouge #beautyprodukte #luxuriös #cherryglow

Summer fashion is on the menu, and while high-street favourites such as New Look and H&M have some great options available right now, one dress from Roman has caught our attention. The floral maxi dress, which is just £48, is part of Roman's summer collection and would be perfect for park picnics or days out at the beach. And, right now, shoppers can save an extra 10% using the code HAPPY. The dress boasts short sleeves, offering some coverage, an attention-grabbing shirred waist, and a tassel tie detail. There's even a modest slit in the skirt for that extra bit of breeziness, reports Nottingham Post. When it comes to accessorising, the options are endless. Dress it up with sparkling heels and gold trinkets for formal occasions, or pair it with ballet flats and standout sunglasses for casual garden get-togethers. The dress comes in a selection of different patterns, too, including various floral prints and an on-trend polka dot print. The dress comes in sizes 10 to 20. However, several sizes are already sold out in some of the patterns. If your size isn't available, Phase Eight also offers a fantastic range, including this floral maxi dress (£109, originally £189) with long sleeves for a similar feel to the Roman dress. For something different yet equally enchanting, Joe Browns showcases a stunning floral knee-length number (£48), available in both petite and regular sizes. It's designed to highlight the waist and features a delightful V-neckline. Customers have been heaping praise on the Roman Originals light blue dress, with one satisfied buyer exclaiming: "It's a lovely colour, and the material keeps you cool in this hot weather." Another happy shopper shared their enthusiasm: "I love this dress. It fits my size 16, hangs nicely, and looks good with my trainers." One more pleased customer couldn't hide their delight: "I just love this dress - I feel amazing in it. When you are a larger person, as I am, it isn't easy to find something you like. The dress flows and gives me a nicer shape. Everyone thought I looked amazing and that I had lost some weight." Yet, not all reviews were positive, with a dissatisfied customer stating: "I loved this dress but was very disappointed with the length. It was far too long." On the other hand, another contented patron praised their find: "(The dress is) beautiful, a wonderful fit, and a perfect length. I'm 5'7". When you put on the dress, you feel amazing. It's a dress that can be worn for any occasion. ". Retailers are stepping up with well-timed promotions to capture consumer interest and minimize the impact of next week's powerhouse Amazon Prime Days event. Beauty shoppers now have more ways than ever online and off to score deals and experiences, and timing is anything but coincidental. Here's how retailers are turning up the heat this July: SEPHORA x Lyft (July 7-10) With a tagline like “Get Beauty from People Who Get Beauty”, Sephora is stepping up and leaning into its in-store associate expertise. Free rides (up to $20) to stores in NYC, LA, SF, Chicago and Seattle combined with in-store perks including skin scans, samples and $10 off purchases over $50, hope to lure shoppers in for expert advice and immersive experiences. Ulta Beauty Summer Sale (July 7-13) Offering up to 40% off top brands like Tarte, Urban Decay and Redken with bonus loyalty points drive both online and in-store traffic. Nordstrom Anniversary Sale Early Access (starts July 9) Beauty exclusives from La Mer, Charlotte Tilbury and MAC Free GWPs and deluxe samples incentivize in-person visits. Walmart Deals (July 8-13) Part of its broader Prime Day alternative event, Walmart will offer budget-friendly beauty essentials and big-name brands at lowered prices, boosting convenience for cost-conscious and deal-focused shoppers. Target Circle Week (July 6-12) Exclusive beauty discounts for members and same-day delivery bonuses perfectly timed to rival Prime Day. With these special promotions and others, shoppers are sure to see major beauty deals, enjoy in-store experiences, and earn rewards by shopping smart across multiple retailers. From drugstore staples to K-beauty saviors. Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy. Some shocking news: toners aren't all that necessary. Still, that doesn't mean they're not a good supplementary treatment to have in your skincare regimen, especially if you have chronically dry, dehydrated skin. Since toners are an optional step, if you do choose to use a toner, it should at least check off a few boxes, but one, in particular, is of the most importance: hydration. But what is a toner, anyway? “A toner is a solution that typically contains actives and is designed to be used after cleansing and before moisturizing. Toners can balance pH, remove impurities, exfoliate, and hydrate. They are not necessary, but they can provide great benefits,” says Dr. Blair Murphy-Rose, a board-certified dermatologist at Laser & Skin Surgery Center of New York and clinical instructor of dermatology at Weill Cornell Medical College. For those with dry skin, “the benefits of a toner depend on the specific formulation and the ingredients it contains. Many toners contain exfoliating actives that help to improve tone and texture, reduce dullness, diminish hyperpigmentation, and bring a glow to the skin,” she adds. Toners made specifically for dry skin can “hydrate, balance pH, and remove residual oils.” Best Calming Toner ANUA Heartleaf 77 Soothing Toner Read more Best Toner for Beginners CeraVe Hydrating Toner Read more Best for Gentle Exfoliation Paula's Choice Skin Perfecting 6% Mandelic Acid + 2% Lactic Acid Liquid Exfoliant Read more While your TikTok and Instagram bookmark tab is likely chock-full of toners on your wishlist, we did the hard work for you by combing through dozens of online customer reviews and our personal stash to find the 12 best toners for dry skin. We also polled Dr. Murphy-Rose for her tips and derm-approved picks. Supple skin is on its way! 1Best Calming Toner ANUA Heartleaf 77 Soothing Toner Now 14% Off Pros Cools stressed skin Cons May not be best for super sensitive skin Key ingredients: Heartleaf extract, Size: 8.45 fl oz Perfect for sensitive skin, this toner feels like a spa retreat for stressed, irritated skin. Heartleaf extract is the star of the show, providing calming and anti-inflammatory properties to prep your skin for subsequent steps. It's also super hydrating and helps restore the skin's barrier. Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars An ELLE editor says: “Not going to lie, TikTok put this toner on my radar. It seems as if I'm prone to stress, and my skin is the first place my worries rear its head, but this toner has helped calm my skin down at its worst times. After cleansing (with the Quercetinol Cleanser, of course), this toner seeps into my skin and leaves it feeling refreshed and soothed.” —Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor 2Best Toner for Beginners CeraVe Hydrating Toner Pros Soothing and hydrating ingredients Cons Some reviewers reported stickiness Key ingredients: hyaluronic acid, niacinamide, ceramides Size: 6.8 oz...

With a full-time job, busy social life, and social media to update, it's challenging to keep up with all the newness out there. So, we've created The Shopping Shortlist: a monthly need-to-know dispatch of the latest and greatest releases that should be on your radar for the month ahead. Here at ES Best, we've got our ears to the ground and our noses pressed up against the digital shop fronts, always looking for the latest fashion, events, and food and drink - so you don't have to. From sell-out collections to limited edition collaborations, with exclusive events, fresh launches and new store unveilings in between, we've got you covered so you don't miss out on a thing. July's biggest shopping news is the return of Amazon's flagship sale: Prime Day. The fun and games (not to mention those mega discounts we've come to anticipate yearly) will kick off on July 8 - 11, which means there are four whole days to take advantage of those exclusive deals. There will be thousands of offers flying around, but if you're looking for a shortcut to the best of them, stay tuned to Standard Shopping where we will have curated guides on everything from clothes and Chromebooks to Kindles and mobile phones. Wimbledon has also kicked off this month, thrilling audiences with on-court action. Whether you've got a hot ticket to centre court or you're planning a watch party picnic, we've got the essentials you need to ace it. And, of course, there's the usual smorgasbord of glittering new launches, exciting collabs and epic shopping drops that will make this July shine. If you're ever at a loss for something to do on the weekend or want to scratch the retail therapy itch, we'll keep this page updated throughout the month; best to bookmark it so you've always got the insider's guide at your fingertips. Don't forget to sign up for the newsletter version of this Shortlist for a weekly digest covering everything from fashion and furniture to tech and travel. Ready, set, shop! Charlotte Tilbury launches summer sale We've all been glowing more than we'd like lately, thanks to scorching temperatures, so if you're looking to sweatproof your makeup, the Charlotte Tilbury summer sale couldn't have come at a better time. Running until July 22, the sale will include some of the brand's bestsellers, including limited edition beauty boxes and 2025 Mystery Boxes, with up to 50 per cent off. You can find the savings on the Charlotte Tilbury Easy Beauty for You app and online at CharlotteTilbury.com. Presenting: Ruggable x Mrs Alice She's been a Standard Shopping favourite since its 2019 launch, and with the new Ruggable collection, our homewares obsession for all things Mrs. Alice's style has only gotten stronger. The 12-strong collection of designs will appeal to maximalists and cottagecore fans, with a distinct English country home feel that will bring life, colour and warmth to any space. Each one is washable and stain-resistant, too, which makes post-dinner party clean-up less of a headache. Find them in a host of sizes, including runners and doormats. From £119. Monsoon sale offers up to 60 per cent off Still haven't figured out what to wear to that wedding that's fast approaching in your diary? Make a beeline for Monsoon, where the summer sale is wiping up to 60 per cent off the RRP of some cute dresses, from midis to cocktail designs. There's even a kids' sale, so you can deck out your mini-me in similar finery. Oliver Bonas adds new styles to the summer sale Hundreds of freshly discounted products and fashion items have joined the sales rail at Oliver Bonas, with up to 50 per cent off the RRP. Expect cute trinkets, homewares, fashion and furniture for a satisfying dose of retail therapy. Ettinger releases luxe golf accessories Looking for a fitting gift for the golf fan in your life? Head to Ettinger, where you can find new leather golf accessories for him and her. Designed to raise your style game, the handmade accessories can be personalised for an extra special touch. The collection spans a golf tidy, accessory caddy, golf pouch, golf scorecard holder, and a golf card case. Prices from £125. Naturium takes Battersea with a pop-up Should you find yourself in SW11 on July 18 - 20, be sure to stop by Malaysia Square near Battersea Power Station to pick up a skin-nourishing smoothie courtesy of Naturium. The beauty brand is rolling into the area with a 'Glow Getter' smoothie truck to deploy goodness to fans, inside and out. You'll also get to check out the new collection of the same name. SPR_COMBO[es]La tendencia de “maquillaje sin maquillaje” sigue fuerte, pero con un giro: ahora no solo queremos lucir frescas, también estructuradas. Y para lograrlo sin 17 productos ni gastar una fortuna, entra en escena Rimmel London Sculpting Palette, una joya low cost con tres tonos que trabajan en sinergia: bronceador, iluminador y colorete, todo en un compacto que cabe en cualquier bolso y cuesta apenas 6 euros. ¿Lo mejor? No es una paleta cualquiera. Fue desarrollada junto a Kate Moss, quien aporta ese toque cool británico a una fórmula práctica y efectiva. La promesa de la paleta es clara: esculpir, iluminar y dar color al rostro con naturalidad. Pero en la práctica, también ofrece versatilidad total: El bronceador es de tono neutro, sin subtono naranja, ideal para contorno sutil o efecto sunkissed. El iluminador tiene destello fino, nada glitter, que aporta ese glow elegante estilo Hailey Bieber. El rubor es rosa-melocotón universal, favorecedor en todo tipo de pieles, que da ese toque de vitalidad instantánea. Además, su textura sedosa y modulable permite trabajar las capas sin dejar manchones ni exceso de polvo. Se difumina fácil con brocha, esponja o incluso con los dedos si estás fuera de casa. Rimmel no es nuevo en el juego, pero esta paleta lleva meses en los primeros puestos de ventas de Amazon y es protagonista de muchos tutoriales en TikTok y YouTube. ¿La razón? Hace el trabajo de tres productos de lujo en un solo gesto. Muchas influencers la comparan con: La Filmstar Bronze & Glow de Charlotte Tilbury (pero 40 euros más barata). El Dior Backstage Glow Face Palette, por su efecto de segunda piel. O incluso con Fenty Beauty, en cuanto a practicidad y pigmentación. Además, en un contexto donde buscamos optimizar rutinas y espacio (bye neceser gigante), una paleta todo en uno tiene un valor emocional: es eficiente, compacta y libre de complicaciones. Por 6 euros, la Rimmel Sculpting Palette ofrece calidad, practicidad y versatilidad. Perfecta para principiantes, minimalistas, chicas que viajan o quienes buscan un glow con poco esfuerzo. No sustituye a productos de gama alta en textura extrema o larga duración tipo red carpet, pero para el día a día y looks de oficina o citas, es más que suficiente. Además, es un recordatorio de que el buen maquillaje no tiene por qué costar una fortuna. Porque al final, el estilo es lo que haces con lo que tienes, no lo que cuesta. @mundistyle

In honour of their charitable work with The King's Trust, the human-rights attorney and the beauty mogul sat down with Glamour's global editorial director Samantha Barry to discuss sisterhood, advocacy, and why showing up for women isn't a luxury, it's a legacy. The first time Amal Clooney met Charlotte Tilbury, the human rights lawyer was preparing for her wedding. Charlotte arrived at her front door heavily pregnant and wheeling five oversized suitcases of makeup. Amal blinked at the sheer theatricality of it. “Is all that for me?” she asked. For the renowned makeup artist, that was travelling light. By the time of the wedding, Charlotte was no longer just the makeup artist getting the bride ready—she was an invited guest. Their connection, built on shared energy and strong maternal figures, became the beginning of something much more enduring: a sisterhood rooted in purpose, ambition, love, and a healthy dose of honesty. They come from different worlds (although as Charlotte points out, both are Aquarius with Pisces mothers)—one a decorated human rights lawyer, the other a global beauty entrepreneur. Amal has led landmark cases for women who went on to be Nobel laureates – like Nadia Murad and Maria Ressa. She has defended political prisoners, helped free journalists across continents, and shaped justice systems from Myanmar to The Hague. As cofounder of the Clooney Foundation for Justice with her husband, actor and director, George Clooney, she has now created a global network that provides free legal representation to thousands of women and girls around the world and helped free dozens of journalists who have been imprisoned for their speech. Charlotte has built a bona fide beauty empire valued at over $1 billion, was the first makeup artist to receive an MBE—member of the Order of the British Empire, an honour awarded by the monarch for a particular achievement—and is a definitive staple in makeup bags for millions of people across the globe. I've known both women for years. Amal and I have been close friends since our single days in London, when I was working as a television producer for the BBC and Amal was already a phenomenal legal mind working as a barrister at law firm Doughty Street Chambers. I met Charlotte at Amal's wedding, where the sparkle on her eye shadow was rivalled only by her energy on the dance floor. Since then I've followed their work and their life paths. On a sunny June morning, I sit with both women in Amal's English country home to do more than just catch up—to discuss empowering initiatives that are dear to them both. Amal and Charlotte have just been at Buckingham Palace where they've used their friendship as a launchpad for real impact via their work with The King's Trust, a charitable organisation founded by King Charles III (then Prince Charles) in 1976. It was renamed from The Prince's Trust in 2024 and focuses on providing young people who are facing challenges with mentorship, funding, job training, and skill building. Both Amal and Charlotte have spent the last four years mentoring and uplifting young women from around the world—Kenya, Pakistan, India—many of whom are survivors of poverty, forced marriage, or systemic violence. The award created by the Trust in Amal's name honors one extraordinary young woman each year, while Charlotte hosts hands-on workshops to teach entrepreneurship and confidence. And then there are the Albie Awards, hosted by the Clooney Foundation for Justice—an annual event that shines a spotlight on the unsung heroes who are fighting for justice: journalists, advocates, and human rights defenders risking their lives for truth. Charlotte is not only a sponsor but truly committed to the vision. This fall the Albies will take place in London for the first time at the city's National History Museum. Amal's kitchen table, where we settled in to do our interview, still held the remains of breakfast. There were updates about children, requests for tea and Coca-Cola, and gentle teasing. Amal's husband, George, popped in and out—always charming, always supportive, joking about his rival photo shoot taking place in the garden. This is a friendship that glows with love and joy, but it's also girded by hard work, deep trust, and shared mission. There is fun , yes, but also courtroom advocacy, cross-continental mentorship, and real-time strategy over WhatsApp. It's women who understand that showing up for one another isn't a luxury, it's a legacy. Samantha Barry: Let's go back to that first meeting between you two. What do you both remember? Amal Clooney: When Charlotte showed up at my door with all those suitcases, I was aghast. I was like, “Are you going to need all of those products?” But I loved her energy and we got on so well. Charlotte Tilbury: I fell in love with Amal because she's such an inspiration. And I met her mother Baria, too; she's actually helped me when I had to go and do TV interviews. I think all the women in her family are actually very inspirational. I mean, Amal obviously is a major champion of empowerment of women around the world. You're an inspiration to all and to me. Amal: Well, can I just say I feel the same about you because I'm always so proud, because I think people meet Charlotte and they see this really attractive, bubbly, friendly, really down-to-earth person. And I'm always keen to point out, “By the way, she's one of the most successful female entrepreneurs to ever come out of the United Kingdom.” Amal, this weekend you talked about George in such a beautiful way. Can you share what he means to your work? Amal: I have a partner in life who is so supportive of what I do. So I don't feel like I have to apologize for it or rein it in. And I remember when I became a mom, which was obviously a new frontier, he was the first one to say, “I know you've got this speech at the Security Council. You have to go, I've got the kids, don't worry about it.”...

Amal and husband George Clooney share two children Kayla Grant Link copied Taylor Hill/WireImage Amal Clooney NEED TO KNOW During an interview with Glamour, Amal Clooney revealed how she maintains privacy in her household The activist is a mom of two children: 8-year-old twins Ella and Alexander Amal and George Clooney welcomed their twins in June 2017 Amal Clooney will do anything to maintain her family's privacy. The activist, 47, recently spoke with Glamour about her partnership with husband George Clooney, her private family life and boundary setting in a conversation with Charlotte Tilbury. Amal, who shares 8-year-old twins Ella and Alexander with the Oscar-winning actor, 64, revealed that when guests visit her home, she takes away their phones to create a safe space for private moments. "Creating private moments and spaces is becoming increasingly difficult. But that's also why we entertain a lot at home," she told the outlet. "I now have a phone basket that I use to take everyone's phones away!" "It's important to get that balance where you have time alone with your family and with your friends where people feel like you can have a safe and frank exchange," she added. "And I would say becoming a parent means you're more troubled by some of the intrusions. So we do the best we can to minimize any impact on our children. We don't put our children out there, we've never put their photo out there or anything like that." Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Amal Clooney and George Clooney Following their Italian wedding in 2014, George and Amal welcomed their twins Alexander and Ella in June 2017. The Clooneys are very discerning about choosing work projects to ensure their kids take priority. "In marriage, and now with the kids, you give away the selfishness of only looking out for yourself," George told PEOPLE. "It's a wonderful thing. Amal and I talk about it every day. We feel so lucky." George may be an A-list celebrity, but he isn't immune to the woes of parenting. For now, the actor says he gets a little help from the jolly guy in the big red suit when his twins are misbehaving. "They're still all into the Santa thing, which is very helpful because when my kids are acting poorly, let's say in July, I [get] a call from Santa,” he shared with PEOPLE in December 2023, adding that he cast a “friend” as the fictional character. " I actually have a buddy whose [caller ID] comes up 'Santa.' ” Taylor Hill/FilmMagic Amal Clooney and George Clooney The PEOPLE App is now available in the Apple App Store! Download it now for the most binge-worthy celeb content, exclusive video clips, astrology updates and more! Despite keeping their family life mostly private, George can't help but rave about his little ones. The Ticket to Paradise actor recently gave a sweet update about parenting the twins at the 2025 Tony Awards. “They want to see Taylor Swift," the actor told E! News. "The funniest part is that they have no idea of references. Robert DeNiro will be at the house and they're like 'Who's that?' They don't care." He then revealed that, despite their lack of knowledge of film legends, both Ella and Alexander are big fans of Wicked. “They're looking forward to the second part," he told the outlet. Their triumph at the 2022 Euros turned England's Lionesses from little-known footballers into national heroines. And if the tournament made them famous, it also transformed their lives off the pitch. From lucrative brand ambassadorships with high-end fashion labels such as Gucci to turns on the red carpet in dresses worthy of a Kardashian, England's female footballers now enjoy more than a touch of glitz and glamour. Once badly paid and barely recognised – who could forget goalie Mary Earps complaining before the last Euros that Nike hadn't even bothered to print replica shirts with her name on them – the nation's female footballers now have a soaring commercial appeal. So as they prepare to face France at 8pm tonight in their first game of this year's Euros – and inspire a new generation of young women with their sporting prowess – Molly Clayton reveals which of our Lionesses enjoys the most luxurious lifestyle. The Gucci model Shoots for Vogue, GQ and Elle Magazine. Modelling for Calvin Klein. Gucci snapping her up as a brand ambassador. Clearly, as well as being an impressive England captain, Leah Williamson, 28, has a catwalk-worthy fashion career too. One of the biggest earners off the pitch after leading the Lionesses to victory at the Euro 2022 final, the blonde beauty has a deal with Nike and has collaborated with global brands such as Aston Martin, Pepsi, Walkers and Mastercard. With 1.1 million Instagram followers, she has new advert partnerships with Weetabix and Cadbury, along with six children's books, titled The Wonder Team. With the deals comes the gloss: her recent lavish Mallorcan holiday to an Ikos resort would have set her back in the region of £1,000 a night. She is rumoured to be dating former model and Miss USA Elle Smith – both have posted about each other on social media. Ella the business brainbox With her ever-present fake eyelashes and love of make-up, Manchester United midfielder Ella Toone, 25, often showcases her beauty routine on her own YouTube channel. And with a canny business acumen to boot, Ella has already shaped an enviable off-pitch career. The first England women's player to trademark her name, she's set up her own brand, ET7, which includes a football academy for young girls. The name is inspired by her childhood hero, Portuguese footballing superstar Cristiano Ronaldo, whose own brand is called CR7. With some estimating her worth at more than £1 million, last month she set up her own creative agency, Amicizia, which aims to connect female athletes to commercial and marketing opportunities with top brands. Her sponsors include make-up company Charlotte Tilbury, orthodontic brand Invisalign and McDonald's, with her yearly earnings estimated as upwards of £200,000, fuelled by her popularity on social media. At one point, she was one of the top five most viewed athletes on TikTok. Ella has 737,000 Instagram followers and her own BBC podcast with best friend and fellow Lioness Alessia Russo, with whom she has appeared on the front cover of fashion and beauty magazine Elle. Ella loves nothing more than a red carpet bash. In a relationship with footballer Joe Bunney of Stalybridge Celtic FC, she regularly treats her fans to glimpses of their lavish holidays abroad and spa days at five-star hotels. Lauren's ooh la la lego Proving that every passion can be profitable, Manchester City forward Lauren Hemp, 24, has topped up her estimated £400,000 salary with a sponsorship deal with Lego. Devoted to creating Lego masterpieces in her downtime, saying it's 'the best way to relax', she's even made the Mona Lisa out of the bricks. Her other sponsors include Nike and Sports Direct. Lauren also has the support of her girlfriend, former Liverpool midfielder Ashley Hodson. Together for two years, the pair recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Paris, where Lauren saw the Mona Lisa in her more traditional setting. Shy superstar with an ex on the team Growing up, Lucy Bronze lived on Lindisfarne – also known as Holy Island – off the windswept coast of Northumberland. Her grandmother was caretaker of Lindisfarne Castle and today the outline of that building is tattooed on Lucy's wrist. Shy into adulthood, she was diagnosed with ADHD and autism in 2021. But neither her isolated upbringing nor her neurodiversity held her back. Rather, she's said she uses the intense focus associated with her conditions to her advantage – and now the 33-year-old is one of the biggest earners in the game. She reportedly took home £200,000 a year while playing at Barcelona before her move to Chelsea in 2024. Big money deals followed her triumph at the last Euros, with Pepsi, EE, Klarna and Visa among her backers. Her former girlfriend is fellow Lioness Keira Walsh. Fashion week regular She earned almost £2 million in 2023 alone, according to Forbes magazine. That same year, Alessia Russo's transfer from Manchester United to Arsenal made her one of the most expensive female footballers on the planet. Her contract is said to be worth more than £500,000 a year and her commercial appeal is just as lucrative. She has deals with Gucci, Adidas, PlayStation, Beats by Dr Dre and last month was gifted an MGS5 EV car, which she proudly showed off on Instagram. A regular at London Fashion Week, Alessia, 26, has appeared on the cover of magazines such as Women's Health. The BAFTA TV Awards in May saw her in a £1,295 Roland Mouret dress, right. Revealing outfits... on pitch too! Hair scraped back and with braces on her teeth, Chloe Kelly scored that late winning goal against Germany at Wembley in 2022, famously taking off her top in celebration. Since then, she has revelled in her success with a glossy makeover....

THE GUCCI MODEL SHOOTS for Vogue, GQ and Elle Magazine. Modelling for Calvin Klein. Gucci snapping her up as a brand ambassador. Clearly, as well as being an impressive England captain, Leah Williamson, 28, has a catwalk-worthy fashion career too. One of the biggest earners off the pitch after leading the Lionesses to victory at the Euro 2022 final, the blonde beauty has a deal with Nike and has collaborated with global brands such as Aston Martin, Pepsi, Walkers and Mastercard. With 1.1 million Instagram followers, she has new advert partnerships with Weetabix and Cadbury, along with six children's books, titled The Wonder Team. With the deals comes the gloss: her recent lavish Mallorcan holiday to an Ikos resort would have set her back in the region of £1,000 a night. She is rumoured to be dating former model and Miss USA Elle Smith - both have posted about each other on social media. LAUREN'S OOH LA LA LEGO PROVING that every passion can be profitable, Manchester City forward Lauren Hemp, 24, has topped up her estimated £400,000 salary with a sponsorship deal with Lego. Devoted to creating Lego masterpieces in her downtime, saying it's 'the best way to relax', she's even made the Mona Lisa out of the bricks. Her other sponsors include Nike and Sports Direct. Lauren also has the support of her girlfriend, former Liverpool midfielder Ashley Hodson. Together for two years, the pair recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Paris, where Lauren saw the Mona Lisa in her more traditional setting. SHY SUPERSTAR WITH AN EX ON THE TEAM GROWING up, Lucy Bronze lived on Lindisfarne - also known as Holy Island - off the windswept coast of Northumberland. Her grandmother was caretaker of Lindisfarne Castle and today the outline of that building is tattooed on Lucy's wrist. Shy into adulthood, she was diagnosed with ADHD and autism in 2021. But neither her isolated upbringing nor her neurodiversity held her back. Rather, she's said she uses the intense focus associated with her conditions to her advantage - and now the 33-year-old is one of the biggest earners in the game. She reportedly took home £200,000 a year while playing at Barcelona before her move to Chelsea in 2024. Big money deals followed her triumph at the last Euros, with Pepsi, EE, Klarna and Visa among her backers. Her former girlfriend is fellow Lioness Keira Walsh. FASHION WEEK REGULAR SHE earned almost £2million in 2023 alone, according to Forbes magazine. That same year, Alessia Russo's transfer from Manchester United to Arsenal made her one of the most expensive female footballers on the planet. Her contract is said to be worth more than £500,000 a year and her commercial appeal is just as lucrative. She has deals with Gucci, Adidas, PlayStation, Beats by Dr Dre and last month was gifted an MGS5 EV car, which she proudly showed off on Instagram. A regular at London Fashion Week, Alessia, 26, has appeared on the cover of magazines such as Women's Health. The BAFTA TV Awards in May saw her in a £1,295 Roland Mouret dress, right. BURBERRY CLAD GOALIE BURBERRY HANNAH Hampton - the longhaired goalkeeper with the girl-next-door looks - certainly has big shoes to fill after Mary Earps surprisingly announced her retirement from the squad last month. The 24-year-old Chelsea player has posed in Burberry for Elle magazine and counts Nike and Extra chewing gum among her corporate sponsors. She also works with Birmingham Children's Hospital after enduring numerous eye operations as a child to cure a squint. Hannah was told she would never be a professional sports player. ' I've gone through life proving people wrong,' she said recently, words that inspired devotion among her 228,000 Instagram followers. Her relationship status isn't known. DUBAI DEVOTEE SHE never travels without her Louis Vuitton luggage, can often be seen posing in a Maybach car, and enjoys swanky trips to Dubai, staying at the luxury Five resort there. Chelsea star Lauren James, 23, has treated herself to some of the finer things in life since her key role in the Lionesses' 2023 World Cup campaign. While her relationship status isn't known, she's close to her older brother Reece, who plays for the Chelsea men's team. She has commercial deals with Nike, Google Pixel, Optimum Nutrition, Sure deodorant and Walkers. The superstar siblings often attend red carpet events together. But while she is reportedly on £350,000 a year at Chelsea, Reece earns £250,000 a week. KOOKY STYLE SO DEVOTED is she to tattoos that midfielder Georgia Stanway, 26, not only has around 100 of her own inkings, but she's also learned to tattoo other people. The Bayern Munich star's kooky style has won her sponsors including Nike and an advertising deal with Celsius drinks, who featured on her Instagram page, where she has 433,000 followers. Off the pitch, she's been with Toulouse rugby league player Olly Ashall-Bott since 2022....

The Mancunians performed another two hour set at the Principality Stadium Sienna Miller was among the celebrities in Cardiff to watch the second Oasis reunion show tonight. The A list actor hailed the show as the 'greatest' she'd ever seen. Other famous faces to watch the performance included former Doctor Who star Matt Smith, who was also at last night's gig, and makeup mogul Charlotte Tilbury. Danny Dyer, Holly Willoughby and Vernon Kay were some of the stars on show for last night's concert. When Sienna was asked by The Mirror what she thought of the concert, she joked: "It was alright," before revealing she was there for both Cardiff gigs. "It's the greatest show I've ever seen. The love and the nostalgia and the joy, it's like saving the world." Matt Smith said the show was "amazing". Oasis returned for a second night at the Principality Stadium to perform another two hour show, with the 23 song setlist unchanged from last night. The set started with Hello, the first song on 1995's (What's the Story) Morning Glory, and again ended with Champagne Supernova. The Gallagher brothers again strode onto the stage, arm in arm, as they did on Friday night. Liam then bowed down before his brother, as seen on fan footage of the gig. Like the first night, Liam enjoyed some banter with the crowd. After Bring It On Down, he asked the crowd to 'do the Poznan', the celebration which Manchester City fans took from Polish side Lech Poznan, where supporters turn their back to the game and jump up and down, arm in arm. Noel also got involved. Before beginning Half The World Away, he joked: "This is for the Royale Family!" During the final bars of Whatever, Liam changed the words and sang a few lines from The Beatles' Octopus's Garden. During Don't Look Back in Anger, tributes were again paid to victims of the Manchester Arena attack, with images of bees appearing on the big screen. Ending with Champagne Supernova, the band played the same setlist as the opening show of the tour. The brothers from Burnage were again joined on stage by guitarist Paul 'Bonehead' Arthurs, who is back with both Gallaghers for the first time in 25 years after leaving the group in 1999. The founding members were joined by long-time members Andy Bell, previously of shoegaze icons Ride, and guitarist Gem Archer, who replaced Bonehead. Completing the line up is new drummer Joey Waronker, who recently performed on Liam Gallagher and John Squire's recent album. Touring members also include Christian Madden on keyboards, Jessica Greenfield on backing vocals, Alastair White on trombone, Steve Hamilton on saxophone and Joe Auckland on trumpet. Next up for the band is a five night residency at Heaton Park, with gigs on Friday, July 11, Saturday, July 12, Wednesday, July 16, Saturday, July 19 and Sunday, July 20.

I always ask for a Sephora or Ulta gift card, so I can pick what I'd like. If she keeps up with trends, she may have some of the trendy things already or may have tried them and disliked them. If you would really like to get her some actual items (which I totally get), I would recommend the eadem or ole henricksen lip balms in a color that she may like, I love the Dieux instant angel moisturizer (it's 20%off now at Sephora), there are some new Dior or Charlotte tilbury blush sticks that have been very popular, make up by Mario just released liquid matte eyeshadows that a lot of people are excited about, the nars eyeshadow sticks may be a bit more user friendly (the living sin color is gorgeous!) . I love the prequel skincare line (have it at target, on their website, and on Amazon), and it's safe for most skin types. The cleanser is fantastic (called the glenser), and they also have a makeup removing oil (haven't tried it yet). They also have a great milkey toner, and a hydrating serum called the quench. Good luck!

Make just a few of these hair, fragrance, makeup, and skincare swaps, and you'll start to save $$. 1. CeraVe's Retinol Serum, which lives up to the CeraVe name and uses *encapsulated* retinol to reduce the appearance of scars and pores without flaking or redness. If you haven't gotten into retinoids yet or are worried about irritating your skin, this gentle but effective serum is a great option — and reviewers say they like it better than other more expensive options (like Murad's Retinol Serum, which retails for $92). And remember, like with any retinol (that actually works) *just do not use it every day. * Start slow and work yourself up if needed, paying attention to your skin. Promising review: "I absolutely love this stuff! I saw a dermatologist on TikTok who raved about this product and tried it out, and it's been the most amazing stuff! It's helped my face to clear up very quickly removing all of the blemish spots and dark spots around my face. It's been one of the best products I've added to my face routine. This would be great for all ages/stages and for any weather types. It doesn't moisturize much, but that's not it's intention, and there is no scent, so I'd imagine it's great for all skin types and hypoallergenic." —Successful Solo Promising review: "I bought this for my teenager to use for his acne scars, but he ended up not using it. I ran out of my Murad retinol serum, so I gave this a try. I actually like it better than the Murad! It absorbs quickly, with zero smell or irritation. As with any retinol product, be sure to wear sunscreen when you're going to be outside." —C. Munsterman Get it from Amazon for $18.68. 2. E.l.f. Halo Glow Liquid Filter that reviewers say is comparable to (or even better than) Charlotte Tilbury's famous Flawless Filter. Apply this as a luminous, blurring base, mix it with your moisturizer or foundation, or dot it over makeup as a natural-looking highlight. It's formulated with hyaluronic acid and squalene for a boost of hydration too! Promising review: "This stuff is so legit I've gone through three bottles. Adds the perfect glow to your skin! Sometimes I use it under foundation, and sometimes, I use it solo with a bit of concealer. I will never not repurchase it for the price and how beautifully it sits on the skin. This stuff is viral for a reason!!" —mapagill Promising review: "If you like Charlotte Tilbury Flawless Filter, this is leaps and bounds better! Just buy it. The coverage is better and makes my skin have the most amazing natural glow! The colors run with a more warm/yellow undertone, which worked great for me! Spend a fraction of the price and just get it; you will be happy you did!" —Amazonreview Get it from Amazon for $14 (available in 12 shades). 3. And their Halo Glow Beauty Wand, a buildable liquid highlighter formula that delivers a majorly radiant, lit-from-within finish to your skin without lots of glitter (like Charlotte Tilbury's highlighter blush wands). The cushion-tip applicator is super easy to apply, too! One reviewer says it's an alternative to the Charlotte Tilbury highlighters! It was an easy decision to purchase it because the price was relatively low compared to other highlighters. It is worth every penny and more! I've seen this shade applied on different skin tones and it looks beautiful on everyone! Just the right shimmer, not glitter. It's gorgeous!" —Joyinmyheart Get it from Amazon for $9 (available in three shades). E.l.f. also has reviewer-loved glowy blush and contour shades in the same wand design!...

SPR_COMBO[de]Eines der größten Schönheitsunternehmen der Welt ist Berichten zufolge einen Verkauf von sich selbst. Anfang Juni berichtete WWD, dass Coty erwägt, seine Verbraucher- und Prestige-Divisionen zu veräußern, darunter einige der bekanntesten Marken von Beauty wie Covergirl sowie Chloé- und Hugo-Chef-Parfums. Die Ankündigung versetzte den Aktienkurs von Coty 13 Prozent auf 5 USD; Die Veräußerung beider Waffen würde im Wesentlichen mehr als 120 Jahre als Unternehmen beendet. Coty lehnte es ab, sich zu dem Bericht zu äußern. Trotz seiner Größe und Stall bekannter Namen hat das amerikanische Konglomerat in den letzten Jahren Schwierigkeiten, mit seinen Konkurrenten Schritt zu halten. Innerhalb des Portfolios seines größten Anteilseigners Jab Holdings ist Coty das schlechteste Kapital und senkt den Ausblick im letzten Geschäftsjahr, wobei weitere Umsatzrückgänge projiziert werden. Coty hat versucht, sein Ansehen zu verbessern. Seit seinem derzeitigen CEO Sue Nabi im Jahr 2020 eintraf, hat das Unternehmen das Fett getrimmt und nicht-Kernmarken wie Professional Lines Wella und OPI abgebrochen. Aber es bleibt immer noch seine äußeren Kollegen wie L'Oréal und Elf Beauty zurück, und im Mai verkaufte es Skkn von Kim, der Prestige-Hautpflegemarke, an seinen Gründer zurück, den Multi-Hyphenate-Reality-Star Kim Kardashian und ihre Bekleidungsfirma Skims, nachdem die Marke versäumt hatte, mit Schaufenster für Furore zu machen. Die Kerngeschäfte, Duft- und Drogerie -Make -up, stehen ebenfalls unter Druck. Während der Duft die kategorische Kategorie der Branche ist und Coty einige der weltweit bekanntesten Düfte der Welt herstellt, ist der heftig wettbewerbsfähige Sektor mit neuen Herausforderern gefüllt. Die Bemühungen, das Summen wie trendige Körpermists für Calvin Klein und die Wiederbelebung von Marc Jacobs Beauty zu fördern, sind in einem von Nischenspieler und Tiktok -Viralität dominierten Markt ein Rückgang des Ozeans. Die Drogerie -Marken haben ebenfalls unterdurchschnittlich geschafft. “So ziemlich alles in der Messe hat nicht funktioniert … Ich gebe ihnen viel Anerkennung dafür, dass sie kreativ sind und Dinge ausprobieren”, sagte Lauren Lieberman, Geschäftsführer bei Barclays Consumer Practice, in der Bemühungen zur Wiederbelebung von Covergirl. Sie bemerkte auch die gedämpfte Wiederbelebung der Philosophie, die Hautpflege und die Bade- und Körperlinie, die ein großer Erfolg in den Aughts sowie die Sun Care Line Lancaster war. Mit dem Rücktritt von Jab Holdings 'langjähriger Vorsitzender Peter Harb im April wird neue Führung wahrscheinlich für ein neues Denken bereit sein. Wenn Coty versucht, Käufer von Gerichts zu nehmen, sind potenzielle Bieter schlank und würden wahrscheinlich in einige ausgewählte Kategorien fallen. bricht zusammen, wer interessiert sein könnte – und warum – unten. Die Kronjuwelen Prestige -Duft bleibt Cotys heißeste Eigenschaft. Es enthält langfristige Lizenzen für Chloé, Gucci, Hugo-Chef und Calvin Klein, einige der berühmtesten Modehäuser der Welt. Hugo -Chef wird als die größte Marke des Unternehmens angesehen, die rund 10 Prozent oder rund 585 Millionen US -Dollar in Höhe von rund 9 Prozent und 7 Prozent des Gesamtumsatzes des Unternehmens umfasst. Dies sind wünschenswerte Vermögenswerte, selbst mit intensiver Konkurrenz durch Inseln auf dem Weg. Diese Düfte des Modehaus sind weit verbreitet, bekannt und haben ein integriertes Prestige und Dynamik. Ein Spezialist für Duftlizenzspezialist wie Interphlum, das für Lacoste und Anna Sui Parfums herstellt, könnte theoretisch interessiert sein. Seit 2022 hat es DKNY wiederbelebt und die Linie neu anspricht, nachdem LVMH sie an die G-III-Gruppe, ein Modeportfoliounternehmen, abgeladen hatte. Das spanische Konglomerat Puig könnte auch ein Anwärter sein; Während es sein Vertrauen in die Lizenzierung verringert hat und sich stattdessen auf den Besitz von Marken verändert hat, nachdem sie Byredo und Charlotte Tilbury aufgenommen haben, verwaltet es geschickt ähnliche Modehaus-Duftmarken wie Carolina Herrera und Jean-Paul Gaultier und könnte dazu beitragen, dass die Marken frische Energie injizieren könnten. Mode -Lizenzunternehmen wie Tapestry, PVH Corp oder Capri könnten auch daran interessiert sein, ihre Bestände zu diversifizieren und dem Mix Schönheit zu verleihen, insbesondere für bewährte Linien wie Burberry und Calvin Klein, von denen letztere das Modegeschäft besitzt. Der Luxusmarken ' Mutterunternehmen möchten möglicherweise auch ihre Schönheitsangebote wieder in Haus bringen. Der Gucci-Besitzer Kering hat kein Geheimnis aus seinen lauwartigen Gefühlen gegenüber der Gucci-Schönheitsmarke unter Cotys Besitz, die 2028 abläuft, kein Geheimnis gemacht, und Kering hat jetzt eine interne Schönheitsabteilung mit Creed. LVMH, dem Marc Jacobs gehört, hat sich als Expertise in Beauty bewährt und Schönheitsangebote wie Dior und Guerlain verwaltet. „Die Tatsache, dass Coty gedauert hat [as a company] So lange ist, weil Duft ein so großartiges Geschäft ist “, sagte Lieberman. In jüngerer Zeit beginnen Unternehmen wie LVMH und KERING ihre eigenen Schönheitswaffen oder konsolidieren ihre Bemühungen auf andere Weise. Lieberman sagte, andere Firmen wie Puig oder Fashion Lizenzierhäuser könnten alle logische Bieter sein, aber das Reiben ist, dass Cotys Fähigkeit, diese Lizenzen zu verkaufen, nicht eindeutig ist. Abhängig von der Art der unterzeichneten ursprünglichen Vereinbarungen können sie möglicherweise das Eigentum an ein neues Unternehmen übertragen. Massenbeschwerde Cotys Sortiment an Massenmarken wie Rimmel und Covergirl hat eine Namenserkennung, aber das Wachstum hat stagniert, da sie Marktanteile an schneller bewegende Indies wie Elf Beauty und Kiko Milano abgeschlossen haben. Sally Hansen ist laut Nielsen-IQ-Daten die größte Massennagelmarke der USA mit einem Marktanteil von 38 Prozent, obwohl der Umsatz auch gesunken ist, da die Verbraucher länger anhaltende Behandlungen priorisieren. Während die Massenmarken von Coty oft unter den Top 10 rangieren, ist der Drogeriekanal in den USA insgesamt weniger lukrativ geworden, da die Auswahl der Marken und im Geschäftserfahrung nicht mit Amazon und zunehmend Tiktok-Shop konkurrieren. Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass ein strategischer Käufer eine so durchdrungene Marke mit niedrigem Wachstumskaderraum übernehmen möchte, aber Private Equity könnte für die Herausforderung stehen, insbesondere wenn er internationale Möglichkeiten für die Marken sieht. Solche Carve-Outs sind nicht ungewöhnlich in der Schönheit, sondern konzentrieren sich häufig auf Prestige-Marken: Private Equity Firm Advent Creecting im Jahr 2022, um Bareminerals, Buxom und Laura Mercier von Shiseido zu kaufen, während Coty einige seiner professionellen Marken, einschließlich Wella Company, im Jahr 2020 zum Private Equity-Unternehmen KKR abfuhr. Coty besitzt auch einige in Brasilien ansässige Körperpflege -Linien wie Bozzano, Monange, Paixao und Risiken, was für einen inländischen Spieler wie den früheren Aesop und Avon -Besitzer Natura mit seinem Heimatvorteil von Interesse sein könnte. Unabhängig davon, welcher Weg es weitergibt, ist eine Neukalibrierung wahrscheinlich bei Coty erforderlich. Und Käufer achten Sie auf-selbst die bekanntesten Marken von Beauty kämpfen darum, ein sinnvolles Wachstum in einer so wettbewerbsfähigen Landschaft zu erzielen. “[Coty's] Marken sollten relevant sein, aber es ist draußen überfüllt “, sagte Lieberman.
