– Spice strategy. The best journalism often comes from topics that writers are personally passionate about—an obsession they have, or a question they can't stop thinking about. That's what happened for my colleague Jessica Mathews and her new Fortune story about Diaspora Co. The 8-year-old startup now pulling in “mid-millions” per year sells high-quality spices sourced from 140 farms. Founder Sana Javeri Kadri started with turmeric, after noting its growing popularity in the U.S., and has expanded to black pepper, cardamom, spice blends, and more. Among foodies and those who care about high-quality ingredients, the brand is incredibly popular. Jessica reached out to Javeri Kadri because she wanted to know, essentially, why and how her spices taste so good. The founder told her that most spices are indigenous to South Asia, and taste different when grown there—even compared to the same seeds, extracted and planted elsewhere. Diaspora Co. was bootstrapped for five years, before Javeri Kadri raised a $1 million pre-seed round and then a 2024 $1.5 million seed round from a whopping 75 angel investors, from Meena Harris to the founder of Salt & Straw ice cream—a strategy that helped her set aside 35% of the company's equity for farmers and employees. “With the grocery venture capital world right now, you're often selling an unprofitable product at scale and hoping that it'll eventually become profitable,” she told Jessica. “I can't do that for my farm partners—that's a very short-term outlook. I want their kids to inherit their family business, and the family business to be thriving. I want our farmers to be happy,” she says. Read the full story here. Emma Hinchliffe emma.hinchliffe@fortune.com The Most Powerful Women Daily newsletter is Fortune's daily briefing for and about the women leading the business world. President Trump signed his domestic spending bill into law in a Fourth of July ceremony, after the House narrowly passed the bill with a 218-214 vote on Thursday afternoon. Two Republican members joined the House Democrats in opposing the bill. The legislation will increase spending on immigration enforcement while making cuts to Medicaid, SNAP, and clean energy funding. CBS News - Tragedy in Texas. Ten girls and one counselor are currently missing from Camp Mystic, a storied Christian girls' summer camp in Texas, amid severe flooding. The storms have ravaged central Texas and have killed at least 79 people. New York Times - Suriname election. The parliament of Suriname backed Jennifer Simons as the country's first woman president. Simons leads the country's National Democratic Party, which beat out President Chan Santokhi's incumbent party in the most recent general election. Her inauguration is set for July 16. Reuters - A potential trans ban. The U.S. Supreme Court has agreed to take up two cases regarding a ban on transgender women and girls from competing on their school's female athletic teams. Idaho and West Virginia are currently appealing lower-court rulings that block their bans from taking place. Arguments for the case will likely take place in the fall, with a decision expected by June 2026. Because I would never gatekeep, I've rounded up quite the assortment of HuffPost's secret top-sellers and clandestine staff faves that are currently majorly discounted for Prime Day. The Touchland Power Mist Hydrating hand sanitizer is a great option that not only contains 70% alcohol to kill germs but is infused with nourishing skin care ingredients like aloe vera and lemon essential oil to keep your skin from drying out. L'Oréal Lumi Glotion (41% off list price) We've formally called L'Oreal's Lumi Glotion the perfect shortcut to perfect skin and one of the most convincing alternatives to the famed Charlotte Tilbury Hollywood Flawless Filter. Available in five flexible shades, this tinted moisturizer is famous for offering sheer yet luminous coverage and promises to melt seamlessly into skin without setting into fine lines or appearing cakey. Wear it alone, under makeup or as a highlighter and enjoy the formula infusion of long-adored ingredients such as shea butter and glycerin, a humectant that draws moisture into the skin for all-day hydration. Medicube Zero Pore pads (52% off list price) Few items have impressed me as much as these cult-favorite toning facial pads. I've ditched my traditional AHA serums for these bad boys, and my skin has never looked better. The Medicube pads are designed to help exfoliate, balance and brighten skin while reducing oil production, minimizing breakouts and refining the look of pores. They are formulated with powerful alpha and beta hydroxy acids like white willow bark, vitamin C and calming botanical extracts like lavender to soothe skin. I've noticed that my skin is softer, smoother and has a really noticeable glow. Most importantly, I've detected a decrease in melasma, which has plagued me since my pregnancy. They're incredibly potent, and it's very obvious to me why they're so popular. It includes a kitchen spin scrubber, a small flat brush, a sisal brush, two scouring pad brushes, two sponge brushes, two descaling brushes and a velcro adaptor for pads. This little guy will leave no grime left behind! The adjustable trolley handle has two height settings, while the interior compression pad system and organizer makes it easy to load up on clothing. Another option that is said to 'hydrate as it glows' are from Pai. The Impossible Tan Hydrating Self Tan Drops retail for £34 at LookFantastic and shoppers say they 'create a lovely natural healthy looking tan'. Customers of Isle of Paradise share before and after results (Image: Amazon) But, the most affordable option out of the above are the Isle of Paradise drops, part of the Amazon Prime Day sale. A happy customer wrote: "I love this product - I was introduced to it in a gift set and this is me replenishing what I've already used! A couple of drops in my normal moisturiser and I have a natural glow! I keep getting comments on how well I look." Someone else raved about how it extended their existing tan, writing: "I bought these drops to carry on my glow from holiday. I am very fair skinned and even after two weeks in the Maldives I was barely tanned! These little drops were great for adding to that, I used two-three drops in with my nighttime moisturiser two or three times a week, that's all I needed and I got compliments from the first use. I think I looked more glowing from these than the holiday." And a third commented: "I love this. I first tried a sample of this and fell in love. This product lets you control the tan, I tend to go for 4 drops for a natural looking tan. I just drop the tan into my moisturiser and apply it as normal. It takes about 2-4hrs to develop."

SPR_COMBO[es]Si algo hemos aprendido de las tendencias de belleza recientes, es que los productos híbridos —esos que cuidan y embellecen al mismo tiempo— son el futuro. En este escenario aparece el Primer Stick con SPF 50, una barra todoterreno por 12,95 euros que ha conquistado TikTok, los bolsos de las insiders y las rutinas de quienes quieren piel protegida y lista para cualquier maquillaje. Este producto resume a la perfección lo que busca la nueva generación de consumidoras: texturas sensoriales, resultados visibles, cuidado invisible y practicidad máxima. No es solo un protector solar. Es un primer, una base ligera, un escudo urbano y un toque de lujo compacto. Se trata de un primer en formato stick, que se desliza sobre la piel dejando una capa ligera, invisible y suave, al tiempo que protege con SPF 50 de los rayos UVA y UVB. Su objetivo: preparar la piel para el maquillaje, minimizar poros, controlar brillos, alisar la textura… y todo eso mientras actúa como tu escudo solar diario. Lo mejor: no deja rastro blanco, no engrasa y no altera el maquillaje. Es el compañero ideal de retoques en el día a día, incluso sobre el maquillaje ya aplicado. Bolsas, manchas y cansancio: este borrador de Amazon los hace desaparecer al instante     Cabello perfumado, piel fresca y vibes de costa azul: este mist de Zara lo tiene todo     El iluminador de Charlotte Tilbury que da glow sin esfuerzo     El más viral Este producto está alineado con algunas de las tendencias de belleza más fuertes de 2025: Skinimalismo: menos pasos, productos multiusos, piel visible y cuidada. Reaplicación solar práctica: cada vez somos más conscientes de que aplicar protector una vez no es suficiente. Este stick hace que reaplicar cada 2-3 horas sea fácil y placentero. Texturas sólidas: en la era post-covid, amamos los formatos limpios, compactos y sin derrames. Estética “clean beauty”: el acabado suave, sin color y sin perfume remite al lujo silencioso del cuidado personal bien hecho. ¿El secreto? Una fórmula pensada para ser transparente, no comedogénica y ultraligera, pero con un factor de protección alto (SPF 50) que cumple con los estándares más exigentes. Este tipo de productos, además, conectan con el mundo K-Beauty y su obsesión por la prevención, la ligereza y los formatos ingeniosos. También se alinea con el auge del lujo funcional, donde cada producto no solo luce bien, sino que cumple varias funciones esenciales. @mundistyle

Amazon's Prime Day Sale is here with offers on home, electronics, beauty and more. The Vera Wang Princess Eau de Toilette 30ml is one of the most sought-after fragrances on the online giant's platform - now reduced from £42 to £11.97. Prime members can access the vast majority of the exclusive deals and while a membership costs around £8.99 per month, Amazon is letting shoppers try it free for 30 days. It gets users benefits like unlimited one-day and same-day delivery, Prime Videos, ad-free Prime Music and more. The Vera Wang Princess Eau de Toilette is Amazon's number one best-seller in the perfume category and with an overwhelming 54,550 global ratings, the fragrance boasts an exquisite blend with top notes of apple and water lily, a heart featuring pink guava and dark chocolate, and a sumptuous base of amber and vanilla. The lovely heart-shaped bottle also features a regal-looking golden bottle cap with amethyst-coloured crystals. Shoppers can also get the same perfume at Boots, which is currently selling  a 100ml bottle for £26,where it's available for next-day delivery with code FREENEXTDAY. Meanwhile, Charlotte Tilbury is offering its "mood-boosting" Love Frequency Perfume Set for £91 instead of £130 - a saving of 30%. Shoppers can get their hands on the brand's woody floral fragrance in both 100ml and 10ml bottles. The light and floral scent has been described as "perfect for daytime" while some loyal fans have called it their "all time favourite", reports Liverpool Echo. One shopper noted: "What sets Vera Wang Princess apart is its versatility. It seamlessly transitions from day to night, making it suitable for various occasions. Whether you're attending a casual outing or a formal event, this fragrance complements any ensemble and leaves a trail of elegance and charm in your wake." A delighted customer shared their experience: "My wife loves this. It smells beautiful, not too strong but the smell lingers for hours/days. A very sweet floral smell, I guarantee everyone will compliment." Another shopper wrote: "Bought this multiple times as my partner can't get enough of it over more expensive perfumes I've bought her. The bottle size is also great." A third customer expressed their newfound adoration for the fragrance, stating: "First time trying this perfume and I love it that much that I bought another one, got big size bottles and well worth it. It's my new favourite scent." Yet, not all feedback was glowing; one customer lamented the perfume's longevity: "Beautiful scent but doesn't last at all, I have to add more on several times during the day. Smells lovely and fresh though." Another shopper was left wanting more from the fragrance's intensity: "Its a nice perfume but the smell is a bit faint, it's a bit too subtle and doesn't last very long. Really need to sniff to figure out the notes." But a satisfied shopper enthused: "It's versatile for any occasion and leaves a lasting impression. A true masterpiece." For those interested in purchasing, Vera Wang's Princess Eau De Toilette is on sale at Amazon. In other deals, LookFantastic is offering a 50% discount on Versace's Woman Eau de Parfum 50ml, now £33 down from £66. Additionally, Boots has launched a significant fragrance sale, with some perfumes reduced to half price. READ NEXT

Shoppers battling with fine or thinning hair are flocking to buy a budget-friendly haircare range that promises to add 200% more thickness after one use, compared to standard shampoo. The John Frieda PROfiller+ Thickening Shampoo and Conditioner set has left users impressed, due to its ability to quickly add volume and thickness to their locks. And now the duo has 33% off for Amazon Prime Day, dropping from £24.99 to £16.74. For those who aren't yet a Prime member, Amazon is offering a free 30-day trial that lets shoppers enjoy all of subscription's perks, including unlimited one-day and next-day deliveries. The John Frieda PROfiller+ range is expertly formulated with biotin and hyaluronic acid to encourage hair growth while plumping hair follicles with hydration to reduce hair loss due to breakage. The formula is silicone-free and vegan friendly and it's easy to use - apply shampoo to wet hair, lather and massage into the scalp, rinse thoroughly. For conditioning, apply the thickening conditioner to the hair, leave in for a few minutes, then rinse out. Shoppers have reported 'noticeable' results, with many asserting their hair is fuller, thicker and easier to manage. One said: "I've been suffering from hair loss for the last three years, to the point where I was considering buying a wig...my hair is 75% thinner than it was several years ago. I used this shampoo and conditioner yesterday and I immediately noticed a difference, my hair is definitely thicker. Even after one use my hair looks really good, after drying and styling it's soft, shiny and has a lot more volume." Another commented: "I am of an age now where my hair is thinning out but after I've washed my hair and conditioned it with these products, it looks so much fuller and shiny. Being able to get it in the larger packs is great because it saved a little bit of money." "This is the best my hair has felt in years. I normally have to wash my hair every day but not with this combo. Works for me," a third added but a fourth left a remark regarding the scent: "This duo is perfect for creating volume to thin hair however it leaves a weird fishy odour to your hair after use." Other than John Frieda, Philip Kingsley's Density Thickening Shampoo and Conditioner Duo is also proven to improve the health, condition and quality of fine, fragile, and shedding hair. Shoppers can enjoy 12% off and get the set at £54.56. Champo's Pitta Volumising Collection is also formulated to strengthen strands, enhancing volume, shine and manageability and the shampoo and conditioner set retails at £38. One five-star shopper left a suggestion in improving the bottle design: "There is one niggle I have that really does surprise me with the 500ml bottles, they should come with pumps. I have looked at other John Frieda 500ml bottles that come with pumps so why not the new 500ml bottles." Another, however, said he wouldn't recommend purchasing it and explained: "Whilst this creates some volume it leaves the hair very coarse and straw-like in texture, which had led to breakage when brushing. I wish I'd spent a bit more on a professional brand. Wouldn't recommend it." A second also agreed on the post-shampoo "coarse" hair and added: "I've applied a lot of Argan oil to try and soften and untangle it." But a satisfied customer said: "My hair has much more body and looks so much better. I also use the thickening spray which is great." The John Frieda PROfiller+ Thickening Shampoo and Conditioner bundle is available on Amazon for £16.74, or shoppers can buy each product separately at Boots for £9.33 each. ✨ So pleased we finally get to announce this dreamy collab for this years creative graduates or anyone who is entry level into the creative industry. I'm teaming up with Acrylicize as part of their 'Creators in Bloom' series to bring you, 'First Impressions' which will be an evening dedicated to portfolio feedback and socialising. Join us for an exclusive session of portfolio feedback and insight from industry leaders who head up some of the most dynamic creative teams in the business, you'll receieve 'speed critiques' from CD's from Bulletproof, DixonBaxi, VCCP, Modern Citizens, Interbrand, Amazon, OVO, , forpeople, the LEGO Group, Charlotte Tilbury Beauty, The School, ITV, Apple, The School of Life, 160over90, The Romans, Waitrose & Partners to name a few. . Designed for emerging talent, this event offers a rare opportunity to hear directly from those who make the hiring decisions. Discover what truly stands out in a portfolio, what to avoid, and how to craft a body of work that captures attention and gets you hired. Whether you're preparing to enter the job market or looking to refine your portfolio, this session is packed with practical advice, honest critique, and insider tips to help you take the next step in your creative career. Plus, you'll get the chance to hear from a stellar line up of guest speakers; Ren Cavan, Matthew Jones Jones & Acrylicize's own James Burke. As well as 15+ other creative directors signed up to review your portfolios. GUEST SPEAKERS ⭐ Ren Cavan (they/them) is an award-winning creative director, writer and speaker with 15+ years' in brand, music, entertainment, sports (incl. esports), culture, luxe, lifestyle and innovation. They have led 360 campaigns, concepts, teams and events for brands including; Nike, Twitch, Netflix, Red Bull, Arsenal FC, Google, Spotify and Amex, to name a few. They have also been listed as Forbes 30 Under 30 in Media & Marketing and shortlisted in the DIVA Awards. As well as judging the D&AD New Blood Awards or on stage at SXSW Festival with Google. ⭐ James Burke's (he/him) work draws from everyday interactions and spans various mediums, exploring themes like spirituality, consumerism, and social media, while seeking authenticity in modern life. A graduate of Manchester Metropolitan University and founder of Acrylicize, his art has been showcased at prestigious venues such as the Royal Academy of Arts and Miami Art Basel. ⭐ Matthew Jones (he/him) is a Creative Director at THIRD HORIZON Studios. With over two decades of industry experience his career has taken him from a junior designer at Spin to being a partner at Accept & Proceed. He's now leading out a new model of studio suited to today's shifting landscape. Working across sports, fashion, tech, data, with global brands including Nike, IBM, the Design Museum and NASA. He has led teams to multiple D&AD awards and Dezeens' Designer of the Year.

Amazon Prime Day is back. Shoppers can get their hands on bargains from bestselling brands - and this year it runs for four days for the first time. The sale started at midnight on Tuesday, July 8 - but despite its name, shoppers don't just have one day to get their hands on the bargains. It will run all the way until midnight on Friday, July 11, with four whole days to shop the sale. You will need to have an Amazon Prime subscription in order to access the vast majority of the exclusive Prime Day deals. But while a membership usually costs £8.99 per month, Amazon is currently offering shoppers the opportunity to try a 30-day free trial to unlock Prime Day without having to pay a penny. Shoppers who have flocked to previous Prime Day sales will know that deals span a huge range of categories, from high-end tech gadgets to everyday household essentials. Amazon's own devices are virtually guaranteed to feature, with price drops on the likes of Fire TVs and TV Sticks, Echo smart speakers, Kindle and Ring devices. Other big-name brands often pop up in Prime Day events, offering some major savings for shoppers. But whether you're after the latest Ninja air fryer, a new Dyson or Shark vacuum cleaner, or a new Apple or Samsung phone, it's always worth shopping around to check offers from other websites, including the brand's own, to ensure you are snagging the best deal. In addition, price tracking websites should be every shopper's best friend when browsing the Prime Day sale this year. Does your kaftan have a sequin trim? Adorable! Does your holiday tote bag have a shell bag charm? Cute. Does your maxidress have pom-poms dangling from it? Um, OK, I'm sure it's lovely, but let's take a moment here, shall we? Are you completely sure you need to coordinate your beach jellies with your candy-striped shorts and cropped top? Look, I'm going to come out and ask the question here. Have our holiday wardrobes got a bit … overexcited? I don't want to be a killjoy. But there is a fine line between a cheerful holiday aesthetic and looking as though you bought the entire contents of your suitcase while on a sangria-fuelled shopping spree at Gatwick. Beguiling though all this stuff is, there is a point where tomato-print sundresses and sandals with ric-rac lacing stop looking delightfully Dolce, and start looking a tiny bit overwrought. Take a deep breath and put those fringed palazzo pants down. Think loose trousers or shorts, T-shirts or linen shirts, boat shoes or Birkenstocks. No perky sundresses or bedazzling sandals The holiday wardrobe is now as relentlessly marketed in summer as baubles at Christmas and roses on Valentine's Day. The powers that be have figured out that “holiday” is a magic word when it comes to unlocking our purse strings. You can be sensible the rest of the year, but holidays are all about the treats, right? Yes, you absolutely do deserve a treat. I'm on your side here, believe me. It is precisely because I am an absolute sucker for the chic Provençal promise of yet another straw basket that I am getting a bit fed up with how much the holiday glamour industrial complex takes out of my salary. So I'm trying to take the rosé-tinted sunglasses off and remember that living my best life is not actually the same thing as bankrupting myself on loads of gaudy tat. Also, the style tide is turning. I've been to a few fashion shows in the south of France and Italy in the past few months (I know, hard life), which provide excellent opportunities for close study of what fashiony people wear when it's hot. And while long, dramatic dresses and slick tailoring are still pulled out of the bag for fancy evenings, the daytime and travelling looks are distinctly low-key. Think loose trousers or shorts, T-shirts or linen shirts, boat shoes or Birkenstocks. No perky sundresses, no bright co-ords, no bedazzling sandals. The name for this deliberately low-key look? Bore-core. But here's the thing. In the sea of sunny pastels and jaunty polka dots that is the airside Pret queue, it is the traveller in sleek, muted neutrals who stands out. Of course, it has to be done well to work. Good quality fabric is key – but investing in quality linen or Supima cotton makes sense when the pieces you are buying will unpack straight from your holiday suitcase to your home wardrobe. To build this look, start with separates. You want soft tailoring, not athleisure. Look for shorts and trousers with belt loops – a belt adds sophistication without looking fussy – sleek tank tops as a bottom layer, and breezy collared shirts that can be buttoned up smartly or worn open as a beach cover-up. Keep everything in neutrals, but within that, tonal shades are good – not too matchy-matchy. But we still want to feel special, right? As soon as M&S online was back, I snapped up their gold flat sandals (£29.50), which have a comfy adjustable slingback. They are a soft metallic, so easy to wear all day, but glam enough to create a holiday-dinner look with the simplest black dress. As well as gold, I'm backing pale pink as a neutral. Cos has a slim linen waistcoat (£135), which fastens with one button and is in a colour they call apricot, that would make a great travel-day layer but will also work at home. Going on holiday is exciting, but our clothes don't have to be. Model: Amaka at Milk. Styling: Hair and makeup: Sophie Higginson using Sam McKnight and Charlotte Tilbury. Blazer, £198, Reiss. Necklace, £59, Ottoman Hands. Top, £85, shorts, £165 and sandals, £195 all Me & Em. Bag, £180, Cos

PARIS – Puig is celebrating its more than 110 years of existence with a new book, called “Puig, Home of Creativity.” The 148-page tome published by Rizzoli will be sold in select bookstores starting Sept. 2. It focuses on the legacy, values and brands that comprise the company founded by the Puig family, as well as a snapshot of the group's present and future. “In the last few years we have been forced to talk more about Puig than just the brands that we have under our umbrella,” explained Marc Puig, chairman and chief executive officer of the company. That was particularly true since the group went public in May 2024. “When the 110-year anniversary arrived, we felt that many of the stories and things that had happened over the last decade were worth putting in black and white,” he said, adding this was important for the world — as well as company employees — to see. “It's a good reflection of the essence of who we are,” the executive said. “Puig, Home of Creativity” was fashioned to reflect the company's spirit. It is also meant to complement the book Puig published to mark its centenary, called “Puig, 100 Years of a Family Business.” “The 100-year anniversary was an homage to the second generation,” said Puig. At the time, three of the four of the family members who made that up were still alive. But by today, all of them have passed away. “This book is more a legacy for the next generation, because now we're transitioning, from the family point of view, from the third to the fourth generation,” said Puig. “This book is a platform of where we are going.” The company — with fashion and beauty brands including Rabanne, Carolina Herrera, Dries Van Noten and Jean Paul Gaultier — has been developing strongly. Last year Puig's sales were 4.79 billion euros. Its products are sold in over 150 countries. More in Business Puig has grown its worldwide market share of fragrances from 3 percent to more than 10 percent. “We have been able to, over time, propose ideas that broke the molds,” said Puig, explaining that has been in terms of products and storytelling. “We create the environment for people to be able to grow and take risks. “'Home of Creativity' was a good way to express we are a home, because Puig's culture is based on a family's culture that has [infused] through the organization, where you try to take care of people,” said Puig. “But at the same time, you push the limits, and you try to excel at what you do. It's [also] 'creativity,' because we like to think that we are willing to take risks.” The company's choices over the years that have shaped it into what Puig is today — be it the focus on fragrance or niche brands or own brands — are highlighted in the new book. It opens with a photographic look of Barcelona, home to Puig since its conception, and traces the group's evolution until today, when the company is a premium beauty and fashion powerhouse with fragrance, makeup and skin care. There's a dive into the Puig family's history, the company's values and creative partnerships, as well as the thinking behind its brands. This is sprung to life with contributions from the likes of perfume historian Michael Edwards and perfumer Jean-Claude Ellena, images from the archives and newly commissioned photographs. Fourteen of the brands are highlighted, including Rabanne and its iconic metallic chain-mail dress, plus interviews with Charlotte Tilbury, Jean Paul Gaultier and Dries Van Noten, who talks about how his garden has influenced his creative world. A section describes Wes Gordon's succeeding Herrera at her eponymous brand. There is also a spotlight on Uriage's history, among other notable brand moments. Edwards penned a section about the rise of niche fragrances, which are important strategically for Puig, which has brands such as Penhaligon's, L'Artisan Parfumeur and Byredo. Puig's globetrotting is highlighted, as is its product development. With a deep sailing history, a major moment came last year, with the first Puig Women's America's Cup. Puig, on the behalf of his family, asked Ellena to create four colognes in memory of Antonio Puig, who founded the house. “Historically, we had some products that had the Puig family name that we were very proud of and over time they have been disappearing,” said Puig. “We wanted to make an homage to the name and to some of the inspirations for those products that at some point really shaped who we were as a company.” The exercise made the family proud, according to Puig. “There's always the question that you have to ask yourself: What makes that brand or company's personality, its value system? What's the essence that differentiates that company?” said Puig. “What are the characteristics of this company that the family has shaped that we want to maintain?” Change is of the essence. If one stays still, they fall — like in bicycle riding, he said. “But you also have to decide what it is that we want to keep evolving and changing, so that this company can survive and excel going forward,” added Puig. “Creating this book is a long and ambitious process,” said Catherine Bonifassi, editorial director of Rizzoli New York, in a statement. “During this journey, as an editor, you truly get to see the personality of the people you work with, as you are facing together challenges, surprises, creative decisions…, exchanges that reveal the real values of a brand and its people's creativity, openness, commitment and boldness.” “Puig, Home of Creativity” can be pre-ordered on rizzoliusa.com.

*Unbezahlt Werbung* Dank influenster konnte ich ein zweites Produkt von charlottetilbury testen. Und das ist das Lippenöl Unreal Lips Healthy Glow Nectar Oil Strawberry Vanilla! Inhalt: Das Lippenöl enthält hydratisierenden Hyaluronsäure sowie antioxidantreichen Fruchtöle um feine Linien zu glätten und für pralle Lippen zu sorgen. Der Appliktor ist extra gebogen, so dass er mühelos über die Lippen gleitet. Verpackung/Design: Das Lippenöl ist einer rosafarbenen Schachtel verpackt. Auf dieser sind schon passend zum Duft Erdbeeren abgebildet! Nach dem Auspacken hält man eine rosafarbene Tube in der Hand. Darauf sind auch Erdbeeren sowie Lippen abgebildet mit einer goldenen Kappe. Ich finde das Design total schön und ansprechend gestaltet! Duft: Zuerst musste ich natürlich schnuppern: der Duft ist etwas süßlich, es duftet nach Erdbeere, nur Vanille kann ich nicht so heraus riechen. Für mich duftet es ein bisschen wie nach einer leckeren Erdbeertorte. Ich könnte das Lippenöl glatt vernaschen! Anwendung: Durch den gebogenen Applikator lässt sich das Lippenöl viel besser auf meinen Lippen auftragen und verteilen! Ergebnis: Das Lippenöl hat nur einen sehr leichten rötlichen Farbton, aber es sorgt für einen schönen Glanz. Und meine Lippen wirken auch voller! Meine Lippen fühlen sich schön weich und geschmeidig an. Sie sind auch nicht mehr so trocken. Das Lippenöl ist schließlich gleichzeitig auch eine gute Lippenpflege! Die Haltbarkeit ist richtig gut: nach dem Auftragen habe ich ein paar Mal was getrunken und das weiche Gefühl des Lippenöls blieb! Auch fast eine ganze Mahlzeit hielt das Lippenöl durch. Mein Fazit: Ich bin total verliebt in das neue Lippenöl von Charlotte Tilbury. Der Erdbeerduft ist himmlisch schön und das Lippenöl hält unglaublich lange! Noch ein Tipp von mir: Lippenöl in den Kühlschrank legen, dann wird es zum Frischekick! #complimentary #unreallipoil #charlottetilbury #produkttest #produktetesten #produkttesterin #produkttesterinmitherz #blogger #instablogger #instatester #testblogger #testenprodukt #werbung #testen #testerin #producttesting  #tester

✨ Charlotte Tilbury – Unreal Lips Healthy Glow Nectar Oil ✨ Farbe: Juicylicious Candy Fig Ich bin absolut begeistert von diesem Lippenöl! 💖 Es kombiniert Pflege, Farbe und Glanz in einem Produkt – perfekt für den Alltag, aber auch für besondere Anlässe. 🌿 Textur: Die Textur ist federleicht, seidig und überhaupt nicht klebrig. Es fühlt sich angenehm auf den Lippen an, ohne zu verlaufen oder sich schwer anzufühlen. Nach dem Auftragen sind die Lippen geschmeidig, glatt und tief mit Feuchtigkeit versorgt – kein Trockenheitsgefühl mehr! 💧 Wirkung: Die pflegende Wirkung ist sofort spürbar. Selbst spröde oder rissige Lippen wirken schon nach kurzer Zeit regeneriert und gesund. Der leichte Glanz verleiht einen frischen, jugendlichen Look. Besonders toll: Der Glanz bleibt lange sichtbar, ohne dass man ständig nachlegen muss. 🍓 Duft: Der Duft ist angenehm dezent – leicht fruchtig, süßlich und sehr feminin. Nicht künstlich oder aufdringlich, sondern genau richtig, um das Pflegeerlebnis abzurunden. 💄 Farbe: Die Nuance „Juicylicious Candy Fig“ ist ein warmer, natürlicher Ton, der den Lippen eine zarte Farbe verleiht. Sie passt zu jedem Hautton und ist sowohl solo als auch über Lippenstift wunderschön. Die Lippen wirken voller, definierter und glänzend – ganz ohne Aufwand! 👜 Verpackung: Das Design ist hochwertig, handlich und elegant – typisch Charlotte Tilbury. Der Applikator ist präzise und ermöglicht ein gleichmäßiges Auftragen ohne Kleckern. Ideal für unterwegs oder für das schnelle Auffrischen zwischendurch. 🌱 Inhaltsstoffe: Ich schätze besonders, dass das Produkt mit pflegenden Ölen und feuchtigkeitsspendenden Inhaltsstoffen formuliert ist. Meine Lippen fühlen sich genährt und geschützt an – sogar bei kaltem Wetter. 📸 Ich habe es pur getragen und auch über Lippenstift – beide Varianten sehen traumhaft aus! Fazit: Ein absolutes Must-Have für glänzende, gepflegte Lippen – stilvoll, wirksam und angenehm in der Anwendung. Ich werde es definitiv nachkaufen! 💋 influenster charlottetilbury #complimentary #unreallipoil #charlottetilbury
